perturbation.original_text: (a)    Authorized Locations means the locations listed in Schedule "C."
perturbation.changed_text: (a)    Authorized Locations means any location where Sparkling Spring Water Group Limited operates, regardless of listing in Schedule "C."
perturbation.explanation: The original definition ties 'Authorized Locations' directly to Schedule C. The modified definition broadens it to ANY location of the company, creating a contradiction if Schedule C doesn't include all locations.

perturbation.original_text: For the acceptance period and for a period of one year from the Maintenance Commencement Date, and thereafter for as long as the Software is covered by Maintenance Services and is used by Sparkling in accordance with this Agreement, Garman warrants that the Software shall perform in conformance with the Specifications in all material respects.
perturbation.changed_text: For the acceptance period only, Garman warrants that the Software shall perform in conformance with the Specifications in all material respects. After the acceptance period, Garman only warrants that they will make reasonable efforts to conform to Specifications.
perturbation.explanation: The original text warrants performance for a longer duration. The change restricts the period of guaranteed performance, creating ambiguity about the level of service post-acceptance.

perturbation.original_text: Sparkling may terminate this Agreement at any time upon ninety (90) calendar days written notice to Garman. If Sparkling terminates this Agreement pursuant to this Section 17(b), Sparkling shall cease using the Software at the end of the ninety (90) day notice period, and shall certify to Garman within thirty (30) calendar days of termination that Sparkling has destroyed or has returned to Garman all Software, Documentation and Codes.
perturbation.changed_text: Sparkling may terminate this Agreement at any time upon ninety (90) calendar days written notice to Garman. If Sparkling terminates this Agreement pursuant to this Section 17(b), Sparkling may continue to use the Software indefinitely, but will not receive updates. Sparkling shall certify to Garman within thirty (30) calendar days of termination that Sparkling has destroyed or has returned to Garman all Software, Documentation and Codes.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires cessation of software use upon termination. The modified text allows continued use, but without updates. This creates conflict and uncertainty about the rights of Sparkling after termination.
